docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 7,--Improvement in domestic business conditions is ascribed by the Department of Commerce as the explanation of increased United States imports in the first quarter of the year. A decrease in United States exports, particularly to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 7,--Improvement in domestic business conditions is ascribed by the Department of Commerce as the explanation of increased United States imports in the first quarter of the year. A decrease in United States exports, particularly to Europe, with emphasis on cotton and wheat, undoubtedly can be attributed to foreign political tension.

headline.main: IMPORT RISE LAID TO DOMESTIC GAIN; Decrease in Exports in First Quarter Linked by Commerce Department to War Scare SHIPMENTS TO REICH DROP Off 33%, as Britain, Belgium, Holland Also Take Less-- Mexican Expansion Indicated

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Because of the rapid development of passenger business in the New York-South American trade of the American Republics Line, there is a possibility that the four cargoliners Scanyork, Scanstates, Scanpenn and Scanmail may be transferred to this run...
docs.lead_paragraph: Because of the rapid development of passenger business in the New York-South American trade of the American Republics Line, there is a possibility that the four cargoliners Scanyork, Scanstates, Scanpenn and Scanmail may be transferred to this run during the Summer, it became known yesterday.

headline.main: SHIFT SEEN LIKELY FOR 'SCAN' LINERS; Proposal to Transfer Four Vessels to South American Trade Is Considered WERE TO BE WITHDRAWN But Rapid Development of Passenger Service to South Calls for New Plan
